page.title: 07A 'Shire Farmer's Year
page.content: {Jan}Cattle in sheds and sheep outside all need feeding daily.{Feb}Half the suckler herd calves.Manure is spread. {Mar}Ploughed land is cultivated and corn sown.Stone walls and fences are repaired.{Apr} LAMBING.{May}Fertiliser spread on grass fields.Suckler herd go out.Land harrowed and rolled,winter sheds cleaned out, and manure spread on land.{June}Sheep are clipped,lambs dosed to stop worms.Silage is cut,each large round bale stored in a black polythene bag.{July}Haymaking,in small bales.{Aug}Sheep are dipped,mule ewe lambs are sold for breeding.{Sep Corn is combined,straw baled for winter use. Fat lambs are sold weekly until Dec.{Oct}Rest of herd calves. Previous winter's calves are sold.{Nov Suckler herd brought in for winter,fed on hay and silage. Sheep dipped.{Dec Cornfields ploughed. Joanne Common
